channel.title: DNS Hosting
channel.description:
Let me start by saying I'm a complete nerb where it comes to this shit. Ill explain what I've done then what I need.
What I've Done: I rent a vps and ive installed xampp 1.7 with Apache and MySQL. Ive setup phpmyadmin etc etc. I've setup my site in the htdocs folder and can access my site by going to localhost. And Now I've bought the domain dubscape.org
What I need: Can someone please TV me and help me setup dns hosting on my vps. I basically just want my domain to connect to the site on my vps.
Thnx.

item.title: DNS Hosting
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:7, topic:417989”][quote author=ollie123 link=topic=520536.msg3793438#msg3793438 date=1319449367]

Alternatively you can use No-IP and setup a CNAME record on your main domain to point to your no-ip address

Way to say what I said? A no-ip is a static ip…

No, No-IP is a Dynamic DNS service for dynamic IPs.
[/quote]
The info on wiki must’ve been wrong then ;s.[/quote]

It’s quite confusing indeed :s.

Read full topic

Alternatively you can use No-IP and setup a CNAME record on your main domain to point to your no-ip address

Way to say what I said? A no-ip is a static ip…
[/quote]

No, No-IP is a Dynamic DNS service for dynamic IPs.[/quote]
The info on wiki must’ve been wrong then ;s.

Read full topic

[/quote]
Way to say what I said? A no-ip is a static ip…[/quote]

No, No-IP is a Dynamic DNS service for dynamic IPs.

item.title: DNS Hosting
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m confused, sorry. But doesn’t DNS stand for domain name server?
To setup your DNS all you have to do is set the name server’s… so the static ip or the ip will suffice…?

Read full topic
